org.xmlrobot.name: org.xmlrobot.parent
org.xmlrobot.key: The parent project is the foundation for a suite of related XML-based tools or libraries to build a future Extensible Operative System (EOS). The parent project is a structured Maven Parent Project, a frequently XML programming order in Maven builds. This implementation centralizes configuration, dependencies, and properties that are inherited across complex POM child projects (frequently referred to as sub-projects or "modules"). The parent project contains a complex pom.xml file that sets settings, dependency ordering, plugins, and other configurations that will be inherited by all child projects. It sets project-inherited properties like Java version, dependency versions, or custom variables to main- tain order. Instead of duplicating configurations across multiple projects, these are maintained inherently in the parent POM.
